originalText.text: Went online several times to pay the toll bill but nothing on their system, 3 months later I get 8 letters by mail with overdue payments. This is the most elegant way to still from New Yorkers. I am disgusted and donâ€™t want to raise my kids here, New York is not only dirty but is also full of thieves dressed in suits living like leeches from the hard working residents.

originalText.text:
Why should the citizens of New York City have to put up with a subpar transit system that reeks of corruption and theft of services?  You folks need to clean house and get rid of the people that suggest things like the 511 telephone line. That line never gets me through to a live human being.  At bottom, MTA has set up a system that will never work for constituents and then it expects us to pay the bill for illusory support.  There should be an order to show cause filed as to why a magistrate should not be assigned to run the MTA operations while the group changes leadership. The leadership at MTA is unresponsive, is stealing money from constituents, is doing a very poor job in ensuring communications between Constituents and the MTA. The creation of that 511 service was just the last straw. It shows how disrespectful and unhelpful the MTA intends to be.

When is the next public hearing?  I want to come testify about these dispositive issues.

originalText.text: I agree with the other comment that they are obviously stealing money and not sending reminder notices. Their moronic system didnâ€™t recognize my license plate number as part of my account, even though it is listed on my ez pass, which I had on me too but it didnâ€™t scan. So I got a violation in the mail and I immediately paid the toll back in January. Didnâ€™t send any letters after saying toll was due or payment hadnâ€™t been received. Received a collections violation notice in May with a $50 fee added to it. Called in(again) they wonâ€™t do anything about it. Now Iâ€™m having to send proof of payment in to collections. Such a headache, the worst. They are thieves, but I shouldnâ€™t be surprised by that as they are the government. Thieving, gaslighting and dishonestly is what they do best. .

originalText.text: in my opinion they are just stealing peoples money... like they have a system that if you don't pay a toll for any mistake, they wont tell you until 90 days, and every month that goes through they will charge you 110 dollars on fees for late payments, instead of sending letters every month, I don't have a problem paying this for I see it from the people that doesn't have money or low income, this is really abusive, this right here just made take the decision of leaving New York and it stpd laws and system that makes people lose all their money...

originalText.text: Gave me a toll of 4$ for a bridge 3 hours from me. My vehicle with specified plate never went through this toll/bridge. Camera incorrectly said it's my plate, photo of plate has glare and can't determine plate number. I contacted immediately after every letter I received. They added a 50$ late fine and sent to collections BEFORE DMV investigation was complete!! Horrible business process. Now I'm dealing with debt collectors and wasting many hours on phone calls because of MTA's mistakes. ðŸ–•ðŸ–•ðŸ–•
